org.jtrim.swing.access

Class DelayedDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.swing.access.DelayedDecorator

  • public final class DelayedDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the JPanel factories required for the ComponentDecorator. These panels are used as the glass pane of the component managed by the ComponentDecorator.

    There are two panel factories used by ComponentDecorator: One is to be immediately installed when the group of rights associated with the ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable and one to be installed after a certain time elapses and the rights are still unavailable.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently. Not however that this is not true for the DecoratorPanelFactory instances.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    ComponentDecorator

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getDecoratorPatience(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Returns the time to wait to use the panels created by the MainDecorator instead of the ones created by the ImmediateDecorator in the given time unit.
      DecoratorPanelFactory getImmediateDecorator()
      Returns the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately as the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable.
      DecoratorPanelFactory getMainDecorator()
      Returns the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator are still unavailable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DelayedDecorator

        public DelayedDecorator(DecoratorPanelFactory mainDecorator,
                long decoratorPatience,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Creates the DelayedDecorator with the given panel factory and timeout to replace the panel applied immediately. Using this constructor will have an immediate decorator which is invisible but blocks all user access to the decorated component.
        Parameters:
        mainDecorator - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator are still unavailable. This argument cannot be null.
        decoratorPatience - the time in the given time unit to wait to use the panels created by the mainDecorator instead of the ones created by immediateDecorator. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeUnit - the time unit of the decoratorPatience argument. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • DelayedDecorator

        public DelayedDecorator(DecoratorPanelFactory immediateDecorator,
                DecoratorPanelFactory mainDecorator,
                long decoratorPatience,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Creates the DelayedDecorator with the given panel factories and timeout to replace the panel applied immediately.
        Parameters:
        immediateDecorator - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately as the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable. This argument cannot be null.
        mainDecorator - the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator are still unavailable. This argument cannot be null.
        decoratorPatience - the time in the given time unit to wait to use the panels created by the mainDecorator instead of the ones created by immediateDecorator. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeUnit - the time unit of the decoratorPatience argument. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • getDecoratorPatience

        public long getDecoratorPatience(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Returns the time to wait to use the panels created by the MainDecorator instead of the ones created by the ImmediateDecorator in the given time unit.
        Parameters:
        timeUnit - the time unit in which the the timeout value is to be returned. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the time to wait until using the MainDecorator in the given time unit. This method always returns a value greater than or equal to zero.

      • getImmediateDecorator

        public DecoratorPanelFactory getImmediateDecorator()
        Returns the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately as the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable.
        Returns:
        the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component immediately as the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator becomes unavailable. This method never returns null.

      • getMainDecorator

        public DecoratorPanelFactory getMainDecorator()
        Returns the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator are still unavailable.
        Returns:
        the panel factory whose panels are used to replace the glass pane of the decorated component after the given timeout elapses and the group of rights associated with ComponentDecorator are still unavailable. This method never returns null.
